Description:
Project Planning: Develop comprehensive project plans, defining project scope, objectives, timelines, and deliverables in collaboration with stakeholders and team members.
Resource Allocation: Identify and allocate resources, including human resources, equipment, and budget, required for the successful execution of IT projects.
Risk Management: Conduct risk assessments and develop mitigation strategies to address potential project risks and issues proactively.
Project Execution: Oversee the day-to-day execution of IT projects, ensuring adherence to the project plan and maintaining project documentation.
Stakeholder Communication: Communicate regularly with stakeholders, providing project updates, managing expectations, and addressing concerns or queries.
Team Leadership: Lead and motivate cross-functional project teams, fostering a collaborative and high-performing work environment.
Quality Assurance: Implement quality assurance measures to ensure that project deliverables meet established standards and requirements.
Change Management: Manage changes to project scope, timeline, or resources and assess their impact on project objectives.Skills
Skills:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
PMP (Project Management Professional) certification.
Minimum of 5 years of proven experience as an IT Project Manager, leading and delivering complex IT projects.
In-depth knowledge of project management methodologies, tools, and best practices.
Strong understanding of IT systems, technologies, and software development processes.
Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams.
Effective problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
Experience in managing projects through the full project lifecycle.
Proficiency in project management software and tools.
Strong organizational and time management skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
